artist: Artist: Follower of Jan Brueghel the Elder
creditline: Gift of the Muschenheim Family, in memory of Linda A. Muschenheim, Docent 1971-1977
description: landscape with mountains and city on the water at Left, trees at Right; Madonna and Child, donkey and three other figures in Lower Right Corner
markings: on back of frame: Anderson Galleries Sticker
text: Reduced to ant-like scale, the Madonna and child serve as mere measuring sticks for gauging the vast wilderness surrounding them on their way to Egypt. The heightened perspective, peering into the valley in the background, also helps reveal the daunting immensity of the landscape. In the theology of nature, which was very popular in early modern Europe, the so-called infinite landscape was interpreted as a revelation of God.
title: Imaginary Landscape
